title: Generic kernel features
description: Configuration options for generic kernel features, anything that doesn't specifically fall into any other category.

options.name: CONFIG_KLOG_LEVEL
options.title: Klog log level
options.description:
The klog log level. Only values less than the klog level will get logged, the others will get discarded. This can be:
1 - FATAL
2 - ERR
3 - WARN
4 - INFO
5 - DEBUG
Either the number or the name can be used.

options.name: CONFIG_KLOG_COLOR
options.title: Klog color support
options.description: Enable if you would like klog to use colored output using ANSI sequences.

options.name: CONFIG_OPTIMIZATIONS
options.title: Generate optimized code
options.description:
The optimization level. Can be:
- 0 (None)
- 1 (Basic)
- 2 (Modest)
- 3 (Aggressive)
- fast (Very Aggressive)
Each of these directly coresponds with gcc/clang's -O* flags.
